questions.question: You must not question .............................. does not concern you.
My sister reads .............................. she gets some free time.
questions.description: Both when and whenever are possible here, but whenever is more emphatic.

questions.question: Ria is confident ............................ she will win the race.
You have to decide ........................... subject you want to study.
questions.description: Which and what are often both possible with little difference of meaning.

questions.question: Aunt Polly suspected ........................ Tom was playing some tricks on her.
questions.description: The conjunction 'that' can connect the main clause to a subordinate noun clause.

questions.question: .............................. she was behaving so strangely was not clear to us.
questions.description: The question word why indicates reason.

questions.question: My grandmother can only walk slowly ........................ she has arthritis.
questions.description: So indicates the result because indicates the reason.

questions.question: ......................... it tried very hard, the cat could not climb the tree.
questions.description: All of these conjunctions have the same meaning. Even though is more emphatic.

questions.question: ........................... you are determined you can succeed in whatever you do.
questions.description: Whether cannot be used to indicate a condition.

questions.question: The man asked ........................ I could help him.
questions.description: Both if and whether can be used to introduce an indirect question.

questions.question: She waited in the park .......................... her friends arrived.
questions.description: Unless means if not. Until indicates time.

questions.question: .......................... you give me the keys of the safe, you will be shot.
questions.description: Unless indicates a condition. It means if not.
